intro: Lastrea stierii, commonly known as the Stier's lastrea, is a succulent plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, commonly referred to as the ice plant family, and is characterized by its fleshy, cylindrical stems. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers that are typically yellow or orange in color. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, adapting to poor soil conditions and low rainfall. Due to its unique appearance and resilience, it is often cultivated as an ornamental plant in dry gardens.
